I cannot predict the future with certainty. but i can say that there is a growing appreciation and recognition of the cultural value of these traditional crafts around the world. there is increasing interest in sustainable and ethically made products, which has led to a greater demand for traditional crafts from indigenous communities.

many organizations and initiatives are working with these communities to help them promote and sell their craft products in a fair and sustainable way. this not only supports the artisans but also helps to preserve their cultural heritage and traditional techniques.

furthermore, many indigenous communities are passing down their knowledge and skills to younger generations and creating new opportunities for their crafts to thrive. therefore, it is possible that these traditional crafts will continue to flourish and evolve in the future, helping to preserve the cultural identity and heritage of these communities for generations to come.
